intro: Tetranthera angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Tetranthera angustifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
